qas.question: Who's Christology focuses on the death and Resurrection?
How is the crucifixion related to the resurrection per Paul?
What term does Paul use for the Gospels?
Paul claims the Resurrection was needed for what reason?

answers.text: based on the plan of God

qas.question: How does Paul view the Resurrection of Jesus?
At what time is it believed Paul wrote 1 Corinthians?
By what plan did Paul write some of the Gospels?
When have cosmic events usually happened?
What is the birth of Jesus thought to be in history?
Why is it believed that Paul was born?

context: <a0_0>Paul's Christology<a0_0/> has a specific focus on the death and resurrection of Jesus. For Paul, the crucifixion of Jesus is <a1_0>directly related<a1_0/> to his resurrection and the term "<a2_0>the cross of Christ<a2_0/>" used in Galatians 6:12 may be viewed as his abbreviation of the message of the gospels. For Paul, the crucifixion of Jesus was not <b8_0>an isolated event<b8_0/> <b7_0>in history<b7_0/>, but a cosmic event with significant eschatological consequences, as in 1 Corinthians 2:8. In the Pauline view, Jesus, obedient to the point of death (Philippians 2:8) died "<b5_0>at the right time<b5_0/>" (Romans 4:25) <a3_0>based on <b6_0><b9_0>the plan of God<b9_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/>. For Paul the "<a4_0>power of the cross<a4_0/>" is not separable from the Resurrection of Jesus.
